data.title: The East Texas Weekend Preview (Feb. 22nd - Feb. 25th)
data.text:
The East Texas Weekend Preview â€” If youâ€™re looking for fun things to do in East Texas this weekend, youâ€™ve come to the right place. Hereâ€™s our rundown of some fun things happening around the area! For a look at live music around East Texas, check out ourLive Music Lineup!

If you know of another event, or see an inaccuracy below, please let us know here.

THURSDAY, 2/22

Into the Woods by Stephen Sondheim

When: 7pm

Where: Henderson County Performing Arts Center, Athens

Cost: $15 (Purchase Tickets Here!)

â€œJames Lapine and Stephen Sondheim take everyoneâ€™s favorite storybook characters and bring them together for a timeless, yet relevant, piece... and a rare modern classic. The Tony Award-winning show is both enchanting and touching. The story follows a Baker and his wife, who wish to have a child; Cinderella, who wishes to attend the Kingâ€™s Festival; and Jack, who wishes his cow would give milk. When the Baker and his wife learn that they cannot have a child because of a Witchâ€™s curse, the two set off on a journey to break the curse. Everyoneâ€™s wish is granted, but the consequences of their actions return to haunt them later with disastrous results. The final reprise of â€œInto the Woodsâ€ reminds us that there will be times when each of us must journey into the woods, but that we must mind the future and the past.â€

Ragamuffin Gospel: Brennan Manning, Rich Mullins & the Good News of Radical Grace

When: 7pm

Where: Regions Bank, Tyler

Cost: Free

â€œJoin Open Table Faith on Thursday, February 22 at 7pm for our monthly Theology LIVE! gathering. Weâ€™ll have a conversation about the â€œRagamuffin Gospelâ€ of Radical Grace, with a little help from two departed ragamuffin saints: Brennan Manning and Rich Mullins. Open Table Faithâ€™s director Jonathan Benedetti will give a short talk introducing the topic, with plenty of time for group conversation. Coffee provided free of charge.â€

Wind Ensemble and Symphonic Band Concert

When: 7:30pm

Where: Rogers-Palmer Performing Arts Center, Tyler

Cost: Free

â€œJoin the Wind Ensemble and Symphonic Band for their first concert of the semester! Admission is FREE and open to the public.â€

AC Student Theater Production â€œThe Haunting of Hill Houseâ€

When: 7:30pm

Where: Temple Theater, Lufkin

Cost: Free

â€œYouâ€™re invited to a party, but not all the guests will survive the night. The ghosts are already waiting. The play is based on Shirley Jacksonâ€™s beloved novel. Adapted for the stage by F. Andrew Leslie.â€

The Drowsy Chaperone

When: 7:30pm

Where: Tyler Civic Theatre Center, Tyler

Cost: $15-$30 (Purchase Tickets Here!)

â€œThe Drowsy Chaperone is a Canadian musical with music and lyrics by Lisa Lambert and Greg Morrison, and a book by Bob Martin and Don McKellar. The story concerns a middle-aged, asocial musical theater fan who, feeling â€œblueâ€, decides to play for the audience an LP of his favorite musical, the fictional 1928 show The Drowsy Chaperone. As the record plays, the show - a parody of 1920s American musical comedy - comes to life onstage, as the man wryly comments on the music, story and actors.â€

FRIDAY, 2/23

Nac Snack Friday

When: 11am-3pm

Where: Visit Nacogdoches, Nacogdoches

Cost: Free Entry

â€œJoin us on the 4th Friday of every month for lunch on the Downtown Square from 11am-3pm for NAC SNACK FRIDAY! February 23rd Trucks:

Shaliâ€™s Indian Kitchen | Reedâ€™s Fish & More | Chamberâ€™s Smokehouse | Taqueria Mi Rancho | White Farmhouse Baking Co.

Weâ€™ll have tables and chairs set up and music piped on the speakers! A great way to end the week with your coworkers, friends, or a date!â€

Flights & Bites

When: 6pm-8pm

Where: Fresh by Brookshires, Tyler

Cost: $7

â€œJoin us for a wine tasting tour with expertly prepared food pairings for $7 per person (ages 21+ only)! Complimentary wine glass for samples and to take home. Live music by Andrew Tooleâ€

Caldwell Arts Academy Black History Month Presentation

When: 5:30pm

Where: 331 S College St, Tyler

Cost: $10 (Purchase Tickets Here!)

â€œCommunity and Families are invited to see our campus Arts Integration showcase, local vendors and food trucks, performances and the Dallas Black Dance Theater with Caldwell Unite opening. Tickets needed for the Dallas Black Dance Theater performance.â€

Into the Woods by Stephen Sondheim

When: 7pm

Where: Henderson County Performing Arts Center, Athens

Cost: $15 (Purchase Tickets Here!)

â€œJames Lapine and Stephen Sondheim take everyoneâ€™s favorite storybook characters and bring them together for a timeless, yet relevant, piece... and a rare modern classic. The Tony Award-winning show is both enchanting and touching. The story follows a Baker and his wife, who wish to have a child; Cinderella, who wishes to attend the Kingâ€™s Festival; and Jack, who wishes his cow would give milk. When the Baker and his wife learn that they cannot have a child because of a Witchâ€™s curse, the two set off on a journey to break the curse. Everyoneâ€™s wish is granted, but the consequences of their actions return to haunt them later with disastrous results. The final reprise of â€œInto the Woodsâ€ reminds us that there will be times when each of us must journey into the woods, but that we must mind the future and the past.â€

The Jazz Connection Duo @ Odd Fellows

When: 7pm

Where: Odd Fellows Wine Bar, Tyler

Cost: Free Entry

â€œGet ready for an evening of great jazz and wine. Odd Fellows is a new wine bar in downtown Tyler. Really intimate place and a nice, chill vibe. Perfect for winding down at the end of a busy day or taking your date out someplace special. Please join us for great music and fun!â€

AC Student Theater Production â€œThe Haunting of Hill Houseâ€

When: 7:30pm

Where: Temple Theater, Lufkin

Cost: Free

â€œYouâ€™re invited to a party, but not all the guests will survive the night. The ghosts are already waiting. The play is based on Shirley Jacksonâ€™s beloved novel. Adapted for the stage by F. Andrew Leslie.â€

The Drowsy Chaperone

When: 7:30pm

Where: Tyler Civic Theatre Center, Tyler

Cost: $15-$30 (Purchase Tickets Here!)

â€œThe Drowsy Chaperone is a Canadian musical with music and lyrics by Lisa Lambert and Greg Morrison, and a book by Bob Martin and Don McKellar. The story concerns a middle-aged, asocial musical theater fan who, feeling â€œblueâ€, decides to play for the audience an LP of his favorite musical, the fictional 1928 show The Drowsy Chaperone. As the record plays, the show - a parody of 1920s American musical comedy - comes to life onstage, as the man wryly comments on the music, story and actors.â€

SATURDAY, 2/24

Leap Year Madness 5K

When: 8am

Where: Rose Rudman Park, Tyler

Cost: $40 (Reserve Spot Here!)

â€œItâ€™s Leap Year!!! This only happens once every 4 years! Donâ€™t miss your opportunity to join the madness! Enjoy a nice Saturday morning run, receive an awesome t-shirt, and earn a one-of-a-kind finisher medal! Oh, and for the competition junkies out there, we have top-of-the-line age group awards as well! Age Groups are as follows; M/F 0-10, M/F 11-14, M/F 15-19, M/F 20-24, M/F 25-29, M/F 30-34, M/F 35-39, M/F 40-44, M/F 45-49, /F 50-54, M/F 55-59, M/F 60-64, M/F 65-69, M/F 70+. There will also be an over male and female, and a male masters and female masters winner.â€

Big Techs Industry Tours & Little Techs Hands-on Showcase

When: 8:30am

Where: Visit Longview Marketplace

Cost: Free (Reserve Spot Here!)

â€œIndustry tours are free, but registration is required. Each tour is approximately one hour, with most tour times at 8:30 a.m., 10 a.m., 11:30 a.m., 1 p.m., and 2:30 p.m. There are 11 tour locations but only 5 tour times, so choose the tours that work best for you. Please note age restrictions and clothing restrictions on some tours. Click here for Tour Information.â€

Linocut Dish Towel Workshop

When: 9am

Where: Plants of Texas, Flint

Cost: $50 (Reserve Spot Here!)

â€œBring a friend and join professional artist and illustrator Kim Wasson Tener as she shares the relaxing and delightful art of linocut. At the end of this two-hour workshop, you will take home your custom linocut block for continued art making, as well as your design printed on a gorgeous cotton dish towel. Perfect for beginners and more advanced artists. Choose between a friendly honeybee or regal monarch. Precut bees and butterflies available as desired. 2-hour workshop, 9-11 am. $50 includes personal instruction, supplies, linocut blocks, and custom printed dish towel.â€

Whitehouse Bakery Co. Ribbon Cutting

When: 9am-1pm

Where: Whitehouse Baking Co, Whitehouse

Cost: Free Entry

â€œBakery will be open from 9-1. Ribbon cutting will take place at 10. To celebrate our official grand opening all customers will receive a free cookie with every purchase on the 24th. Thank you in advance for your patience with parking. Hope to see you there!â€

Rose Seminar

When: 10am

Where: Boboâ€™s Nursery & Florist, Buffalo

Cost: $40 (Purchase Tickets Here!)

â€œJoin us for our annual Rose Seminar! We will have a NEW guest speaker Marie Jenkins! Marie is the General Manager for the Antique Rose Emporium in Brenham, Texas. She holds a masters in Horticultural Science and Landscape Design. She is an award winning landscape designer, a Texas Certified Nursery Professional who is passionate about sharing her love for plants with others. When she is not working at the Rose Emporium, she can be found volunteering at her local animal shelter, horseback riding or playing with her extensive succulent collection. You will not want to this seminar!! Itâ€™s going to be informative and itâ€™s FREE!! See you there!â€

Estate Sale

When: 10am

Where: 205 Meadow Ln, Lindale

Cost: Free Entry

â€œEstate Sale!!! Feb 24 and 25th! Lots of furniture and general household items! Make your own offer on everything! If you can load it you can have it! Couch, coffee tables, bookshelves, kitchen items, etc. everything is as in condition. Dog and cat home (for allergy reasons).â€

Mistletoe Mania Grand Opening Party

When: 10:30am-4pm

Where: 104 E Market Street Suite B, Mabank

Cost: Free Entry

â€œWe survived the fast move, the Ribbon Cutting, and our 2nd busiest season, Valentineâ€™s Day, now it is time to PARTY! Mistletoe Mania is loving our new location and we are not fully set up yet. We have recovered from the season of love and are in gear to bring you the BEST Grand Opening Party! We have a TON of super cool, unique and exactly what you have been asking for NEW INVENTORY we have held back waiting for this day! YOU ARE GOING TO LOVE THIS! What is new? We have brand new, never seen before Cedar Creek Lake Home Decor, we have some really pretty jewelry, new shirts, new signs, new gifts for him, her and kids. We have new candles. You know the rooms we have had shut since the ribbon cutting? FULL OF NEW INVENTORY just waiting to come out for the Grand Opening Party! The Christmas Room will be open, ready for you to take a look in! What else do we haveâ€¦ what fun is a party without FOOD? Did you say you loved Chubby Cheeks Cheesecakes at the Ribbon Cutting? They will be set up giving away cheesecake! We will have more food, drinks of course, door prizes and games. The first 50 people to walk in the door will receive a special gift. The first 10 people to make a purchase will receive an exclusive VIP bag. We are spinning the wheel for discounts. We are having a dance off. We are partying at Mistletoe Mania!â€

Dinosaurs vs Bumblebee & I Heart Cookies

When: 12pm-6pm

Where: Tractor Supply Co., Lufkin

Cost: $5

Advanced Beekeeping Class

When: 1pm

Where: Plants of Texas, Flint

Cost: $30 (Purchase Tickets Here!)

â€œJoin us for our annual Rose Seminar! We will have a NEW guest speaker Marie Jenkins! Marie is the General Manager for the Antique Rose Emporium in Brenham, Texas. She holds a masters in Horticultural Science and Landscape Design. She is an award winning landscape designer, a Texas Certified Nursery Professional who is passionate about sharing her love for plants with others. When she is not working at the Rose Emporium, she can be found volunteering at her local animal shelter, horseback riding or playing with her extensive succulent collection. You will not want to this seminar!! Itâ€™s going to be informative and itâ€™s FREE!! See you there!â€

Texas Art Connection: Book Signing

When: 3pm-6pm

Where: 328 South College Ave, Tyler

Cost: Free

â€œCome meet some of our local artists who are featured in the book â€œTexas Art Connectionâ€. Some of their work will be on display for sale along with a few books, while supplies last. This is a great opportunity to have your book signed by several local artists. And artists can have their book signed by other artists as well. This is a free event with hors dâ€™ouvres and beverages provided.â€

February Hafla

When: 4pm

Where: Glass Recreation Center, Tyler

Cost: $35 (Purchase Tickets Here!)

â€œJoin us for an exciting evening of mesmerizing belly dance performances at the Glass Recreation Center in Tyler, TX, USA. Our February Hafla promises to be a night filled with vibrant music, graceful movements, and infectious energy. Come and experience the magic of belly dance as talented dancers showcase their skills and passion. Whether youâ€™re a seasoned belly dance enthusiast or new to this art form, this event is perfect for everyone. Donâ€™t miss out on this unforgettable night of entertainment and celebration!â€

Sabo Provisions Whiskey Tasting

When: 5pm-8pm

Where: 214 Main Street, Sulphur Springs

Cost: $40 (Purchase Tickets Here!)

â€œAbout the movie: As teenagers, Allie and Noah begin a whirlwind courtship that soon blossoms into tender intimacy. The young couple is quickly separated by Allieâ€™s upper-class parents, who insist that Noah isnâ€™t right for her. Several years pass, and when they meet again, their passions rekindle, forcing Allie to choose between her soulmate and class order. This beautiful tale has a particularly special meaning to an older gentleman who regularly reads the timeless love story to his aging companion.â€

Professional Wrestling - Can You Bear It?

When: 6pm

Where: Timpson Middle School, Timpson

Cost: $15

â€œFUNDRAISER FOR THE TIMPSON ATHLETICS. Live professional wrestling at its best, League of Lions proudly presents CAN YOU BEAR IT. Come out and enjoy one of the best pro wrestling shows in Texas. Complete with a fully stocked concession stand and pick up some merchandise from your favorite wrestler.â€

Bricks & Brews

When: 6pm-8pm

Where: ETX Brewing Co, Tyler

Cost: Free Entry

â€œBricks & Minifigs Tyler, along with ETX Brewing Co., presents Bricks & Brews a night of fun for all builders as well as their friends and family! The night will go from 6:00-8pm consisting of Guessing Games, a Make-and-Take Build, and LEGOÂ® Trivia! We will also have a Make-and-Take build that will be available for purchase to build at the event. Reserve Spot with QR code Here!â€

LMFA Concerts - Grace Pettis

When: 6:30pm

Where: 213 N Fredonia St, Longview

Cost: $25 (Purchase Tickets Here!)

â€œGrace Pettis has been characterized as a bit folk, country/Americana, and a lot of soul. Pettisâ€™s musical influences run the gamut of Southern sounds: from mountain music and gospel to country and folk to R&B and hip-hop.â€

Into the Woods by Stephen Sondheim

When: 7pm

Where: Henderson County Performing Arts Center, Athens

Cost: $15 (Purchase Tickets Here!)

â€œJames Lapine and Stephen Sondheim take everyoneâ€™s favorite storybook characters and bring them together for a timeless, yet relevant, piece... and a rare modern classic. The Tony Award-winning show is both enchanting and touching. The story follows a Baker and his wife, who wish to have a child; Cinderella, who wishes to attend the Kingâ€™s Festival; and Jack, who wishes his cow would give milk. When the Baker and his wife learn that they cannot have a child because of a Witchâ€™s curse, the two set off on a journey to break the curse. Everyoneâ€™s wish is granted, but the consequences of their actions return to haunt them later with disastrous results. The final reprise of â€œInto the Woodsâ€ reminds us that there will be times when each of us must journey into the woods, but that we must mind the future and the past.â€

The Notebook @ Liberty Hall

When: 7pm

Where: Liberty Hall, Tyler

Cost: $9.50 (Purchase Tickets Here!)

â€œAbout the movie: As teenagers, Allie and Noah begin a whirlwind courtship that soon blossoms into tender intimacy. The young couple is quickly separated by Allieâ€™s upper-class parents, who insist that Noah isnâ€™t right for her. Several years pass, and when they meet again, their passions rekindle, forcing Allie to choose between her soulmate and class order. This beautiful tale has a particularly special meaning to an older gentleman who regularly reads the timeless love story to his aging companion.â€

Dance! Featuring the TJC Academy of Dance

When: 7:30pm

Where: UT Tyler Cowan Center, Tyler

Cost: $27-$74 (Purchase Tickets Here!)

â€œRichard Lee and the East Texas Symphony Orchestra are excited to partner again with the Tyler Junior College Academy of Dance for a program featuring original choreography to two ballet favorites. Aaron Coplandâ€™s Four Dance Episodes from â€œRodeoâ€, originally choreographed by Agnes de Mille, features the familiar and infectious Hoedown. Igor Stravinskyâ€™s fiery modern masterpiece The Rite of Spring, created for Ballets Russes in 1913, brings a contrast in style to the Cowan Center stage. Rounding out the program, the ETSO performs Coplandâ€™s stirring Appalachian Spring.â€

AC Student Theater Production â€œThe Haunting of Hill Houseâ€

When: 7:30pm

Where: Temple Theater, Lufkin

Cost: Free

â€œYouâ€™re invited to a party, but not all the guests will survive the night. The ghosts are already waiting. The play is based on Shirley Jacksonâ€™s beloved novel. Adapted for the stage by F. Andrew Leslie.â€

When: 7:30pm

Where: Tyler Civic Theatre Center, Tyler

Cost: $15-$30 (Purchase Tickets Here!)

The story concerns a middle-aged, asocial musical theater fan who, feeling â€œblueâ€, decides to play for the audience an LP of his favorite musical, the fictional 1928 show The Drowsy Chaperone. As the record plays, the show - a parody of 1920s American musical comedy - comes to life onstage, as the man wryly comments on the music, story and actors.â€

Comedy Show

When: 8pm

Where: 106 E Tyler St, Longview

Cost: $15

â€œComedy Show in downtown Longview. Saturday night Feb 24 doors open at 7. Come see Theeban Ganeshawn , Jade Esteban Estrada, Glenn Stuart, and Joie Savageâ€

SUNDAY, 2/25

The Drowsy Chaperone

When: 2:30pm

Where: Tyler Civic Theatre Center, Tyler

Cost: $15-$30 (Purchase Tickets Here!)

â€œThe Drowsy Chaperone is a Canadian musical with music and lyrics by Lisa Lambert and Greg Morrison, and a book by Bob Martin and Don McKellar. The story concerns a middle-aged, asocial musical theater fan who, feeling â€œblueâ€, decides to play for the audience an LP of his favorite musical, the fictional 1928 show The Drowsy Chaperone. As the record plays, the show - a parody of 1920s American musical comedy - comes to life onstage, as the man wryly comments on the music, story and actors.â€

Salsa Speed Date Nite

When: 7pm-8:30pm

Where: INKAâ€™s Restro-Bar, Tyler

Cost: $40 (Purchase Tickets Here!)

â€œSingles, get your dance shoes on and ready to mingle! Itâ€™s speed dating with a twist! Join us at INKAâ€™s Restro-Bar located at 1523 E Erwin St. in Tyler for Salsa Speed Dating for singles ages 35-45. Rose Dusk Events presents Tyler singles with a Valentines dating experience! Salsa dance speed dating is a fun combination of short get-to-know-you introductions or â€œspeed dates,â€ while learning some easy salsa dance steps. And donâ€™t worry if you have two left feet, itâ€™s all apart of the fun!â€

*All dates and information are subject to change. Contact us if there are changes to the schedule or if we left anything out
